WorkItem.Description: It would be great if the current logged on user could be added as a column option to the status tab of an update.

Comments.Message:
+1

In our corp environment, we have approx. 4500 computers spread worldwide so this option would be of a great help.

Any news on this request since the last update from October ?

Thanks in advance.

This tool is AWESOME !

This list can get quite long, especially on a computer that's being used by multiple people via RDP.

Here's what I get when seeing who is logged onto a system with just a few users. The ones that are labeled with Disc as the state are disconnected users, users that disconnected from the machine without logging off.

```
PS C:\> query session /server:SERVER
 SESSIONNAME       USERNAME                 ID  STATE   TYPE        DEVICE
 services                                    0  Disc
 rdp-tcp#1         user004                   1  Active  rdpwd
                   user001                   2  Disc
                   user002                   3  Disc
 rdp-tcp#0         user003                   4  Active  rdpwd
 console                                     6  Conn
 rdp-tcp                                 65536  Listen
```

Can you clarify what you mean by the "current logged on user" in cases such as this?
